duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide operational support for assigned areas, including managing support staff and provider schedules, and improving patient access.
Supervise support staff, handle work schedule matters, and enforce attendance policies.
Track key performance indicators to recognize successful performance and identify problem areas.
Coordinate patient access issues, streamline scheduling workflows, and maintain full provider schedules.
Assist with service line performance improvement projects in collaboration with site leadership.
Establish and maintain working relationships with community partners and collaborators.
Oversee maintenance and function of service line specific equipment and participate in the Performance Improvement Program.
Implement job responsibilities in a manner consistent with the Legacy's Mission, Code of Ethics, and cultural diversity objectives.
Responsible for departmental orders and stocking of supplies, as well as performing other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent, required. Certifications/licenses as applicable to their area of responsibility. At least 3 years’ experience in a healthcare setting, required. A master’s degree in business or healthcare operations (or equivalent) may substitute for 2 years of experience in the healthcare setting. At least 2 years’ experience in administration and supervision of staff preferred. Experience in Microsoft Office Suite and EHRS preferred.
